715159f-a.text:
182-162 East 117th Street, south side, between Third and Lexington Avenues. No. 162 is a two-story frame house, from which
the blinds will soon be removed.
February 27, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

708149f-a.text:
Third Avenue, west side, north from 117th Street, showing in the foreground 2144–2146 Third Avenue, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of 117th Street, two frame houses will still stand in 1934.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York, Negative No. 160

708148f-a.text:
Third Avenue at N. W. corner of 117th Street.
September 12, 1934.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

715158f-a.text:
213 E. 117th Street, north side, east of Third Avenue, showing a rear View of same and an empty 10t at the rearr as viewed southward from 118th Street. The donors report reads"Reported to the Department of Buildings, December 10 1935; visited January 8, 193o. The front was nicely boarded up but the rear was open to a Vacant lot on E. 118th Street. There is a long one story extension which formerly had sky-lights. Building appears to be in a dangerous condition--pa t of the floor is gone, exposing shallow sub-basement. The building and yard were swarming with
children."
1936
Views: 1-2-3
0ift of Committee on Sousing
Charity Organization Society

117-123 Third Avenue, east side, north of 13th Street to 14th Street.
May 19, 1934.
